{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3023225,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-15T01:53:41.682Z","cooked":"

I’ve been trying to use PathPlanner for our autonomous, but I can’t get the robot to turn right. In every other respect, the paths work fine. It turns smoothly, goes the correct distance etc. But if there’s a right turn in the path, it turns left instead. We used sysid to characterize our robot drivetrain, and got pretty good data.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2022-03-15T01:53:41.682Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":444,"reads":276,"readers_count":275,"score":2290.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":405734,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-not-turning-right","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-not-turning-right/405734/1","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3023229,"name":null,"username":"anon37142155","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f08c70/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-15T01:57:30.641Z","cooked":"

I actually experienced this problem earlier this season. It turned out I had inverted the motors incorrectly. So if you are inverting the right side, try inverting the left side instead.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2022-03-15T02:04:52.701Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":73.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":405734,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-not-turning-right","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-not-turning-right/405734/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3023237,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-15T02:04:22.091Z","cooked":"

Does a left curve in the path ALSO make it turn left? If so, that’s weird. If it turns right instead, then you likely have some kind of motor inversion issue

I’ve tried doing that as well, but it doesn’t work. Still the same result.

Yeah, left turns work fine. I have found in my driveVoltage() method, if I swap the left and right voltages it will turn right. But then it only turns right. So basically the same problem.

I’m not sure exactly what could be causing your problem, but you do have kP set to 0. I think SysID gives you a kP, so I wonder if that might be causing this problem.

I’ve tried setting kP and kD as well. That just makes the robot go haywire, not really following the path at all. So does using an actual RamseteController.

viggy96:

I’ve tried setting kP and kD as well.

Did you use the ones from SysID?

viggy96:

So does using an actual RamseteController.

What do you mean by that?

Yeah I used the values from SysID.
You can see in my AutoTrajectory class that I’m using a disabled RamseteController, as per the WPILib documentation.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2022-03-15T03:26:29.562Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":146,"readers_count":145,"score":39.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":405734,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-not-turning-right","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51083,"username":"anon37142155","name":null,"avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f08c70/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-not-turning-right/405734/11","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3023394,"name":null,"username":"anon37142155","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f08c70/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-15T03:40:36.603Z","cooked":"
@Override
public ChassisSpeeds calculate(Pose2d currentPose, Pose2d poseRef, double linearVelocityMeters,
  double angularVelocityRefRadiansPerSecond) {
return new ChassisSpeeds(linearVelocityMeters, 0.0, angularVelocityRefRadiansPerSecond);
  }

Is there a reason you have this over the default ramsete?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2022-03-15T03:40:36.603Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":59.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":405734,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-not-turning-right","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-not-turning-right/405734/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3023404,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-15T03:46:05.155Z","cooked":"

Using the default ramsete also makes the robot go haywire. Not following the path at all, and mostly just speeding forward until I disable the robot.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2022-03-15T03:47:14.911Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":51.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":405734,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-not-turning-right","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51083,"username":"anon37142155","name":null,"avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f08c70/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-not-turning-right/405734/13","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3023408,"name":null,"username":"anon37142155","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f08c70/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-15T03:48:03.936Z","cooked":"

I would suspect that you likely have it characterized wrong then. If you look at the working ramsete I had, its mostly just exactly what WPILib has: https://github.com/pittsfordrobotics/RapidReact2022/blob/master/src/main/java/frc/robot/commands/DrivePathing.java

That’s weird though that feedforward would still be (mostly) correct. I also had no problem using purely feed forward to drive before. But I wasn’t using PathPlanner back then. I was inputting a list of Pose2d waypoints to the trajectory generator and that worked pretty well.

Your ramsete is not going to be doing very well if it is not enabled as from my understanding it does not at all account for the robot pose at all. Are you sure that all of your sensor measurements are inverted/not inverted correctly? It seems like they are not. In your constructor you are inverting the right side, but in your update odometry you are inverting the left encoder.

Shouldn’t it drive pretty darn close just based on feed forward alone? I’m sure ramsete and velocity PID on either side would help make it even more accurate, but the robot should be driving pretty close to the actual path with just feed forward.

Make sure the NavX is inverted.

Turning to the left should make your navx angle increase in value (positive). Like the unit circle.
